title: LDS reports a hard 1,000,000 large binary cap
description:
It's my understanding that you're supposed to be able to load more than 1,000,000 large binaries into a forest.  At LDS this week they said they saw that number as a hard stop.  If that's really true, seems like a bug.  They'd like to load 17,000,000 images into (ideally) one forest.

(Not sure on what version this was seen. If it's not an issue in 6.0-2.1 they'll be happy I suspect.)

changeHistory.comment: Jason, can you give any more information than this?  This does not sound right.

We met with the LDS MarkLogic advisory council and they made a list of a dozen things to talk about.  For this topic they wanted the hard cap raised.  I said it wasn't supposed to be a hard cap (which is what cjl told me a while back).  They said it was, so I said I'd file a bug.  Then we went onto the next topic.

I'd try reproducing myself but it's not easy to load a million+ large binaries on my laptop.  :)
What error do they see when they hit 1M? I can try it myself  early next week. My boxes are used for a stress test this weekend.
I asked that.  They said, "It just stopped loading."

I just loaded more than 1M large binaries (total size > 1TB) into one forest. See

http://hwu3:8001/database-status.xqy?section=database&database=8085898291275749712

I don't think the number of large binaries is what caused the issue for the customer.  Could you collect more information from the customer?
And if they ran into some problem like this, you might suggest they contact support and work through it with them.
I think the customer was just confused and there never was a bug here.  Closing.
